poem:
**Crossword Morning**

chilled air  
prowling through newsprint—  
black squares, white,  
stitched in  
silence—clues  
like whispers,  
unraveling slowly,  
structured chaos—  
fingers trace  
puzzles of  
dawn light  
—ink smudges—  
a quiet game  
waiting,  
beneath coffee's  
steaming breath,  
for answers  
to spill—like  
morning breaking  
over untouched  
snow.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Prize crossword No 29,583". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
